description: This foundation course explores major principles of cellular and molecular biology and is a
prerequisite for all Level II biology courses. Emphases include the structural and chemical
composition of cells, crucial metabolic pathways, fundamentals of cell division, basic
genetics and the scientific method. Labs integrate concepts with problem-solving and
scientific writing. Students attend lectures plus one 2.5-hour laboratory per week. Taught
annually and during Interim. GE: NST-B, NSL.
